Detailed Description

Interface for Robot::compute() to the WorldInformation.

The View class represents the robots view to the world, i.e. a View class describes the information model that should be used for this simulation. This class is designed as a base class for more concrete models. Still there are no abstract methods. Instead, all methods are implemented such, that they throw a NotSupportedOperationException.

Note: Most methods specified in this class need to know the calling Robot, so they determine whether e.g. the own position is queried or the position of an other Robot.

Assigning this class to a Robot corresponds to a "no information at all" model for each Robot.

Definition at line 47 of file view.h.

Member Function Documentation

void View::init ( const WorldInformation &  world_information  )  [virtual]

Although init is trivial, it is nice to have a default constructor in virtual inherited classes. Otherwise every arbitrary deep sub class has to call the non-default constructor. Call this method before using any other method of View.

Parameters:
WorldInformation 

Reimplemented in OctreeView, and SphericView.

Definition at line 199 of file view.cc.

bool View::is_own_identifier ( const Robot &  robot,
boost::shared_ptr< RobotIdentifier >  identifier 
) [static, private]

Helper methods to check if the given Identifier points to the same data object as the given Robots Identifier does. To do so it compares the internal id of the Identifiers. (Thats also why this method is defined as class method (needs friend access)).

Definition at line 72 of file view.cc.

Referenced by delegate_function().

template<typename T>
T View::delegate_function ( boost::function< T(const View *, const RobotData &)>  own_robot_fun,
boost::function< T(const View *, const RobotData &)>  other_robot_fun,
boost::function< T(const View *, const Obstacle &)>  obstacle_fun,
boost::function< T(const View *, const WorldObject &)>  marker_fun,
const Robot &  caller,
WorldObjectRef  world_object 
) const [inline, private]

Given a set of four methods this method decides which to call. This is used by View::get_position for example to delegate the call the View::get_own_position, View::get_robot_position, View::get_obstacle_position, and View::get_marker_position. Which method is called is decided as in View::get_own_position described.

The method uses resolve_*_ref_safe to resolve arguments for the given methods. A notable exception is the own_robot_function where resolve_robot_ref is used instead. This is because Identifier saved in Robot need not be same as saved in RobotData (pointerwise).

Definition at line 41 of file view.cc.

References is_own_identifier().

template<typename T>
T View::delegate_function ( boost::function< T(const View *, const RobotData &)>  own_robot_fun,
boost::function< T(const View *, const RobotData &)>  other_robot_fun,
const Robot &  caller,
RobotRef  robot 
) const [inline, private]

Same as above except that this method only decides between two methods as needed for get_robot_* methods.

View::delgate_function
